formName: Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme - Registration

submission.message:
Your reference number is {summary_ref}.

Thank you for submitting {form_name}

{visiblesummary}

  • I have read the guidance for settings registering for the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme, including the requirement to have regard to guidance issued by Scottish Ministers
  • I have read the summary of information in Annex A for the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme, including the requirement to have regard to guidance issued by Scottish Ministers
  • I am authorised to make this application on behalf of the above childcare provider(s)
  • I certify that the information provided in this application is correct and complete. I understand that, if found to have knowingly given false information, repayment of funding may be required and you may take action against me
  • I understand that is my responsibility to notify you immediately if the certificate of registration provided by the Care Inspectorate should be suspended or cancelled
  • I understand that it is my responsibility to notify you immediately of any significant change to the expected numbers of children attending or expected number of servings provided
  • I understand that it is my responsibility to inform you if I wish to withdraw from the scheme
  • I understand that the scheme may be subject to audit and it is my responsibility to maintain appropriate records regarding enrolled children, records of attendance and receipts for items purchased
  • I understand that any payment received must be declared to HMRC as appropriate as part of the tax return for the business

props.label: html 1
props.content:
Please ensure you register by 23rd July for access to the Scheme from 1 August 2021.

The Scheme

From 1 August 2021, the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme (SMHSS) agreed to fund a daily portion of plain fresh cow’s milk (or specified alternative) and a healthy snack (fruit or vegetables) for pre-school children (from birth to not yet attending primary school) spending two hours or more in the care of a regulated day care provider and/or childminders. Infant formula will be funded for children up to 12 months.

The Scheme aims to ensure that as many pre-school children in day care as possible receive a daily serving of milk and a healthy snack to support the development of healthy eating habits for later life.

Registration is now open for 1 August 2025 – 31 July 2026

Eligibility for care providers

The Scheme is available to all regulated settings offering pre-school day care, regardless of whether they are in receipt of early learning and childcare (ELC) funding. Day care providers must be registered with both the Care Inspectorate and the local authority for the Scheme and provide day care to pre-school children for 2 hours or more per day.

Eligibility for children

All pre-school children (usually aged 5 and under) who spend 2 hours or more in a day care setting which is registered with both the Care Inspectorate and the local authority for the Scheme are eligible to receive the benefit once per day.

 

If you have any enquiries regarding the scheme or how to register please contact Early Learning at EarlyYears-Milk&Snacks@east-ayrshire.gov.uk

Further details about the Scheme can be found at:
https://www.gov.scot/policies/maternal-and-child-health/milk-and-healthy-snack-scheme/

Full statutory Guidance for Local Authorities and Participating (Registered Day Care Settings) can be found at :
https://www.gov.scot/publications/scottish-milk-healthy-snack-scheme-guidance-local-authorities-day-care-settings/

Annex A - Important Information – please read before registering

Information for Settings Registering for the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme

This information is based upon the Milk and Healthy Snack (Scotland) Regulations 2021 which you are advised to read prior to application and should be read in conjuction with the Guidance for the Scheme which will be available from May 2021.

Purpose of the Scheme

1. The Scottish Government's ambition is to ensure that as many children as possible attending eligible settings are in receipt of the milk and healthy snack policy, embedding the habit of regular consumption of high-quality dairy produce and fruit and vegetables from an early age. The purpose of the Scheme is to support improvement in children's health in the earliest years, which is crucial in tackling health inequalities.

Eligibility for the Scheme

2. Childcare settings which are registered with the Care Inspectorate and which provide care to pre-school children for 2 hours or more per day are eligible to apply to join the Scheme.

Benefit

3. Under the Scheme, a pre-school child who is attending childcare for more than 2 hours per day should receive once in the day, the following benefit:

  • 189 mls of first infant formula for children under 12 months
    189mls (1/3 pint) - or a 200ml container- of
  • plain fresh cow's milk (whole milk for children 1 year and over, including the option of semi-skimmed milk for children 2 years and over) ;
  • or, where children cannot consume cow's milk for medical, ethical or religious reasons, plain fresh goat or sheep milk (whole milk for children 1 year and over or to include semi- skimmed milk for children 2 years and over),
  • or where children cannot consume cow's milk, goat's milk and sheep's milk for medical, ethical or religious reasons a specified unsweetened calcium-enriched non-dairy alternative;
  • AND a healthy snack portion ( fruit or vegetables) per child per day.

 

4. Childcare providers should offer cow's milk to children except where children may not drink this for medical, ethical or religious reasons. In these instances, settings should offer a sheep or goats milk, or where those are not acceptable, a specified, unsweetened non-dairy alternative may be offered (details on specification will be included in the guidance). First infant formula can be provided for children up to the age of 12 months.

Funding

5. Funding for the Scheme will be provided via the local authority which will confirm the payment arrangements.

6. Funding provided via the Scheme must be used for the specified benefit only. Families should not be charged for a benefit which has been funded via the Scheme.

7. A childcare provider that is no longer entitled to a payment under the Scheme due to a change in circumstances must inform the Local Authority (acting on behalf of Scottish Ministers) of that change as soon as reasonably practicable.

8. Where there has been a significant change to the number of eligible children enrolled, or to the benefit to be provided in relation to a payment period, the childcare provider must notify the Local Authority EarlyYears-Milk&Snacks@east-ayrshire.gov.uk (acting on behalf of Scottish Ministers).

Guidance

9. Registered childcare providers must have regard to any guidance issued by the Scottish Ministers with respect to the operation of the Scheme: https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ssi/2021/82/contents/made

Provision of information

10. Registered childcare providers must provide specified information as requested by the Local Authority in relation to the Scheme. Information that may be required is listed within the regulations.

Completing data on anticipated servings

11. The information requested on anticipated servings is to enable us to calculate your payment. While children under the age of 6 months would not be offered solid food, for the purposes of administration we ask you to count 1 serving for each day a pre-school child would be offered the benefit under the Scheme, without making this age distinction. So if 3 pre-school children aged 5 months, 2 and 5 attend your provision 3 times a week for 2 hours or more, the number of anticipated servings in that week would be 9.

Definitions

12. Where sessions are referred to please provide information on any period in which care is provided for a child for a total of 2 or more hours in a day.

You may be asked to provide this information for monitoring purposes.

props.label: html 7
props.content:
Care providers may be required to register as a food business with their local authority’s environmental health service depending on the food services provided. Further information can be found at:
https://www.foodstandards.gov.scot/business-and-industry/industry-specific-advice/childminders


If you need to register, a registration form can be found at: Food Safety Childminder food Registration Form (PDF)

Once completed you should submit your registration form to environmentalhealth@east-ayrshire.gov.uk


You may be asked to provide this information for monitoring purposes.

props.helpText: Child eligibility can be checked on the About Tab

props.label: THE EXPECTED NUMBER OF CHILDREN TO BE ENROLLED FROM 1 AUGUST
props.helpText: If registering after 1 August this should be the number of children enrolled at the date of application.

props.label: EXPECTED NUMBER OF DAYS YOU WILL BE OPEN TO PROVIDE CHILDCARE BETWEEN 1 AUGUST – 31 JULY
props.helpText: If registering after 1 August this should be the number of days you will be open until 31 July

props.label: MAXIMUM CAPACITY, IE TOTAL NUMBER OF CHILDREN WHO MAY ATTEND AT ANY ONE TIME
MAXIMUM SESSIONS, IE TOTAL NUMBER OF CHILDREN WHO MAY ATTEND ACROSS ANY ONE DAY
html 10
props.content: Please note that a serving (being the combined portion of milk and a healthy snack) is provided only once per day and this should normally be claimed in the first setting of the day the child attends, ie in a blended model, the service attended in the morning should claim for the child.

props.label: EXPECTED NUMBER OF SERVINGS TO BE PROVIDED IN A TYPICAL DAY
props.helpText: A session may be a morning, afternoon or full day, but must be 2 hours or more. You should count one serving for each child attending one session. If you have a range of attendances, you can use an average figure.

props.label: EXPECTED NUMBER OF SERVINGS TO BE PROVIDED IN A TYPICAL WEEK
props.helpText: If Child A has 3 sessions, Child B has 4 sessions, Child C has 5 sessions this would mean a total of 12 sessions per week. You should count one serving for each child attending one session.

props.label: EXPECTED NUMBER OF SERVINGS TO BE PROVIDED BETWEEN 1 AUGUST - 31 MARCH (TO FINANCIAL YEAR END)
props.helpText: The expected servings per week multiplied by the number of weeks you will be open to provide childcare between 1 August and 31 March.  If you are registering after 1st August you should multiply by the remaining number of weeks until 31 March.

props.label: EXPECTED NUMBER OF SERVINGS TO BE PROVIDED BETWEEN 1 APRIL - 31 JULY (TO SCHEME END DATE)
props.helpText: The expected servings per week multiplied by the number of weeks you will be open to provide childcare between 1 April to 31 July.  If you are registering after 1st April you should multiply by the remaining number of weeks until 31 July.

props.label: EXPECTED NUMBER OF SERVINGS TO BE PROVIDED BETWEEN 1 AUGUST - 31 JULY (FULL SCHEME YEAR)
props.helpText: This is automatically calculated from the two figures above. If you are registering after 1st August you should consider only the remaining number of weeks until 31 July.

props.label: UPLOAD A COPY (SCREENSHOT) OF THE CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION
props.helpText: Please provide a copy of your Certificate of Registration provided by the Care Inspectorate

props.label: html 8
props.content:
Please read and confirm that you agree to the following statements:

  • I have read the guidance for settings registering for the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme, including the requirement to have regard to guidance issued by Scottish Ministers
  • I have read the summary of information in Annex A for the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme, including the requirement to have regard to guidance issued by Scottish Ministers
  • I am authorised to make this application on behalf of the above childcare provider(s)
  • I certify that the information provided in this application is correct and complete. I understand that, if found to have knowingly given false information, repayment of funding may be required and you may take action against me
  • I understand that is my responsibility to notify you immediately if the certificate of registration provided by the Care Inspectorate should be suspended or cancelled
  • I understand that it is my responsibility to notify you immediately of any significant change to the expected numbers of children attending or expected number of servings provided
  • I understand that it is my responsibility to inform you if I wish to withdraw from the scheme
  • I understand that the scheme may be subject to audit and it is my responsibility to maintain appropriate records regarding enrolled children, records of attendance and receipts for items purchased
  • I understand that any payment received must be declared to HMRC as appropriate as part of the tax return for the business

props.label: html 11
props.content:
Privacy Notice

The information you provide will be used for the purpose of checking and verifying your childcare settings, and will allow us to register you with the Scottish Milk and Healthy Snack Scheme and administer any payments due to you. We are legally obliged to safeguard public funds so we are required to verify and check your details for fraud prevention. Your information may be shared with the Scottish Government on whose behalf we are administering the Scheme. We will retain your details for as long as you remain registered with the scheme.

Further details of how we process your data can be found in our Privacy Statements:

www.east-ayrshire.gov.uk/Resources/PDF/E/EducationServicesPrivacyNotice.pdf

www.east-ayrshire.gov.uk/CouncilAndGovernment/About-the-Council/Information-and-statistics/Privacy-Statement.aspx
